00001 /*
00002  *******************************************************
00003  *              PITCH SHIFTER
00004  *******************************************************
00005  *              Tap.Tools Blue Object
00006  *              copyright © 2000-2004 by Timothy A. Place
00007  *
00008  */
00009 
00010 // Check against redundant including
00011 #ifndef TT_SHIFT_H
00012 #define TT_SHIFT_H
00013 
00014 // Include appropriate headers
00015 #include "tt_audio_base.h"
00016 
00017 
00018 /********************************************************
00019         CLASS INTERFACE/IMPLEMENTATION
00020 
00021         The entire class is implemented inline for speed.
00022  ********************************************************/
00023 
00024 class tt_shift:public tt_audio_base{
00025 
00026         private:
00027                 enum constants{
00028                         k_num_temp_signals = 10,
00029                 };
00030                 tt_attribute_value              window_size;                            // size of the delay window in ms
00031                 tt_attribute_value              shift_ratio;                            // amount of pitch shift
00032                 
00033                 tt_delay                                *delay1, *delay2;                       // member tap.tools objects
00034                 tt_phasor                               *phasor;
00035                 tt_buffer                               *window;
00036                 tt_buffer_window                *wave1, *wave2;
00037                 tt_gain                                 *scale;
00038                 tt_offset                               *offset;
00039                 tt_onewrap                              *modulo;        
00040                 tt_add                                  *add;
00041         
00042                 tt_audio_signal                 *temp[k_num_temp_signals];      // Temp Signals
00043                 float                                   buffersize_in_ms;
00044                         
00045         public:
00046                 enum selectors{                 // Attribute Selectors
00047                         k_ratio,
00048                         k_windowsize,
00049                 };
00050                 
00051 
00052                 // OBJECT LIFE ************************************************************
00053                 tt_shift()                                                                              // Constructor          
00054                 {
00055                         short i;
00056                         buffersize_in_ms = 200.0;
00057                         
00058                         for(i=0; i < k_num_temp_signals; i++)
00059                                 temp[i] = new tt_audio_signal(vectorsize);              // allocate temp signals
00060                         
00061                         delay1 = new tt_delay(buffersize_in_ms);
00062                         delay2 = new tt_delay(buffersize_in_ms);
00063                         phasor = new tt_phasor;
00064                         
00065                         window = new tt_buffer(512);
00066                         window->fill(tt_buffer::k_padded_welch_512);
00067 
00068                         wave1 = new tt_buffer_window(window);
00069                         wave2 = new tt_buffer_window(window);
00070                         wave1->set_attr(tt_buffer_window::k_mode, tt_buffer_window::k_mode_normalized_fast);
00071                         wave2->set_attr(tt_buffer_window::k_mode, tt_buffer_window::k_mode_normalized_fast);
00072 
00073                         scale = new tt_gain;
00074 
00075                         offset = new tt_offset;
00076                         offset->set_attr(tt_offset::k_offset_value, 0.5);
00077 
00078                         modulo = new tt_onewrap;        
00079                         add = new tt_add;
00080                                 
00081                         // Default Settings
00082                         window_size = 87.0;                             // must define before setting the ratio!
00083                         set_attr(k_ratio, 1.0);
00084                         set_attr(k_windowsize, 87.0);
00085                 }
00086 
00087                 ~tt_shift()                                                                     // Destructor
00088                 {
00089                         short i;
00090         
00091                         delete delay1;
00092                         delete delay2;
00093                         delete phasor;
00094                         delete wave1;
00095                         delete wave2;
00096                         delete scale;
00097                         delete offset;
00098                         delete modulo;
00099                         delete add;
00100                         delete window;
00101         
00102                         // FREE THE TEMP SIGNALS
00103                         for(i=0; i<k_num_temp_signals; i++)
00104                                 delete temp[i];
00105                 }
00106 
00107 
00108                 // ATTRIBUTES ************************************************************
00109                 void set_attr(tt_selector sel, tt_attribute_value val)  // Set Attributes
00110                 {
00111                         switch(sel){
00112                                 case k_ratio:
00113                                         shift_ratio = val;
00114                                         phasor->set_attr(tt_phasor::k_frequency, (-(shift_ratio - 1.0)) * (1.0 / (window_size * 0.001)));
00115                                         break;
00116                                 case k_windowsize:
00117                                         window_size = clip(val, 1.0f, buffersize_in_ms - 1);
00118                                         scale->set_attr(tt_gain::k_gain_direct, window_size);
00119                                         set_attr(k_ratio, shift_ratio);                         // update the phasor freq based on the new window size
00120                                         break;
00121                         }
00122                 }
00123 
00124                 tt_attribute_value get_attr(tt_selector sel)                            // Get Attributes
00125                 {
00126                         switch(sel){
00127                                 case k_ratio:
00128                                         return shift_ratio;
00129                                 case k_windowsize:
00130                                         return window_size;
00131                                 default:
00132                                         return -1;
00133                         }
00134                 }
00135                 
00136                 
00137                 /*****************************************************
00138                  * DSP LOOPS
00139                  *****************************************************/
00140                 // Because this is a meta-object, it is the user of this object who is responsible for making sure that
00141                 //      the vectorsize of the signals are the same as that of this object.
00142 
00143                 // Publically exposed interface for this object's dsp routine
00144                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *out)
00145                 {
00146                         phasor->dsp_vector_calc(temp[0]);                                       // phasor~
00147                         scale->dsp_vector_calc(temp[0], temp[1]);                       // *~ 87.0              
00148                         delay1->dsp_vector_calc(in, temp[1], temp[8]);          // blue.delai~
00149 
00150                         offset->dsp_vector_calc(temp[0], temp[1]);                      // +~ 0.5
00151                         modulo->dsp_vector_calc(temp[1], temp[2]);                      // %~ 1.0
00152                         scale->dsp_vector_calc(temp[2], temp[3]);                       // *~ 87.0
00153                         delay2->dsp_vector_calc(in, temp[3], temp[9]);          // blue.delay~ (the second one)
00154 
00155                         wave1->dsp_vector_calc(temp[0], temp[8], temp[6]);      // wave~ -> *~ (lookup the window and apply it)
00156                         wave2->dsp_vector_calc(temp[2], temp[9], temp[7]);      // wave~ -> *~ (lookup the window and apply it)
00157                         
00158                         add->dsp_vector_calc(temp[6], temp[7], out);            // combine the windowed delays and write it to output
00159                 }
00160 
00161 
00162 
00163         public:
00164                 // ADDITIONAL METHODS ************************************************************
00165                 
00166                 // clear
00167                 void clear()
00168                 {
00169                         delay1->clear();
00170                         delay2->clear();
00171                 }
00172                 
00173                 // set sample-rate (override the inherited method)
00174                 void set_sr(int value)
00175                 {
00176                         if(value != sr){
00177                                 sr = value;
00178                                 r_sr = 1.0 / value;
00179                                 m_sr = sr * 0.001;
00180                                 
00181                                 delay1->set_sr(sr);     // this method overides the default
00182                                 delay2->set_sr(sr);     // this method overides the default
00183                                 phasor->set_sr(sr);     // this method overides the default
00184                                 window->set_sr(sr);     // the rest are essentially SR independent...
00185                                 wave1->set_sr(sr);
00186                                 wave2->set_sr(sr);
00187                                 scale->set_sr(sr);
00188                                 offset->set_sr(sr);
00189                                 modulo->set_sr(sr);
00190                                 add->set_sr(sr);
00191                                 
00192                                 set_attr(k_windowsize, window_size);
00193                                 set_attr(k_ratio, shift_ratio);
00194                         }
00195                 }
00196 
00197                 // set the vector size (override the inherited method)
00198                 void set_vectorsize(int value)
00199                 {
00200                         short i;
00201                         if(value != vectorsize){
00202                                 vectorsize = value;
00203 
00204                                 delay1->set_vectorsize(vectorsize);
00205                                 delay2->set_vectorsize(vectorsize);
00206                                 phasor->set_vectorsize(vectorsize);
00207                                 window->set_vectorsize(vectorsize);
00208                                 wave1->set_vectorsize(vectorsize);
00209                                 wave2->set_vectorsize(vectorsize);
00210                                 scale->set_vectorsize(vectorsize);
00211                                 offset->set_vectorsize(vectorsize);
00212                                 modulo->set_vectorsize(vectorsize);     
00213                                 add->set_vectorsize(vectorsize);
00214                 
00215                                 // RESIZE THE TEMP SIGNALS
00216                                 for(i=0; i<k_num_temp_signals; i++)
00217                                         temp[i]->alloc(vectorsize);
00218                         }
00219                 }
00220 };
00221 
00222 
00223 #endif  // TT_SHIFT_H
